long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Floozifier started out a way to replace all references to Bitcoin on the web to "Flooz," and that was good. Now it's expanded its repertoire to change a whole bunch of 21st century terms into ones from the 1990s and before. You will either be mightily amused or not understand why I made this. Or maybe both. 

This extension uses word-replacing code published by Tom Maxwell in a 9to5Google article. I thank him for making this important project possible.
